website_summaries.verdict: A compact, mid-range machine with some high-end features.
pros: Includes two containers and a strainer
cons: Consumers should monitor temperature, especially if using the 24-hour fermentation cycle

customer_reviews.title: Could set fire to your house
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. I know it looks beautiful and has some great reviews but read the bad ones. I bought that yogurt maker twice. And every time the inside melted and the appliance almost cought fire. IF I WOULDNT HAVE BEEN THERE MY HOUSE WOULD HAVE BURNT! This item should be recalled
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Machine started melting and could have caught on fire
customer_reviews.text: This product caught fire on the insides on my first use. Thank God I was around and started smelling the plastic insides burning. See photos. These are the things you read about homes catching fire because of appliances . I never in a million years expected this. This product should be recalled.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyann Della Casa

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times now, and have had fantastic results every time! The strainer basket is perfect for Greek yogurt, and I also use it when making homemade cottage cheese! When I make yogurt, when it is time to chill it, I pour it into the small 4 ounce mason jars over a fruit sauce so the kids can get out single servings of it whenever they want it. It is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.text: The heating elements melted the plastic interior on its first time use. Sure I can return it, but because postage costs more than the machine itself, I'll take it as a learning experience... don't buy cheap, in the end it turns out expensive.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mendes

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed. Right on the box it says how easy ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. Right on the box it says how easy the yogurt is to make...mix it, set it and strain it! Yet, when you read the instructions, you need to cook the milk in a separate double boiler up to 185 degrees, cool it, and THEN start the easy process. False advertising. I don't have that kind of time or energy. If it really was quick and easy, as advertised, this would be great. As it is, off to Habitat for Humanity since I waited too long to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Gates

customer_reviews.title: don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these items and it melted at the first use, asked amazon for a replacement thinking that it was a malfunction of that item and to my surprise also the second item melted at first use. I believe that the product is not trustworthy and an hazard both for health, plastic fumes in the yogurt and in the house, and not safe to leave unattended because it can easily burn down your whole house. It was extra expensive for me because i had to pay for shipment both ways to receive and to send back. i would not recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Carlotta bruni

customer_reviews.title: The temperature would not regulated properly. It would overheat ...
customer_reviews.text: The temperature would not regulated properly. It would overheat to 125 F and later in the cycle would drop to 105 F. The yogurt would not set even after multiple attempts.
customer_reviews.author: penny marrou

customer_reviews.title: DASH out and get this Greek Yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one gave up the ghost after a couple days. Amazon sent me a return label and I ordered this one on my next payday. I have made 3 for 3 perfect batches of yogurt in 2 days. No, I am not addicted to yogurt...I just can't live without it. Nice little yogurt maker. I recommend this as it is an inexpensive way to find out if you really want to make yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: hombre243Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Can't include the necessary thermometer?
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a 5 star rating, however I very disappointed that this doesn't come with the thermometer that is absolutely necessary to make yogurt. I've owned vintage older yogurt models from the 70's and 80's and back in the day, as a courtesy to the consumer a thermometer was included. Mind you it's a cheap add on and I can run out to my local Target or Walmart store to buy one for around $4.00 - but the inconvenience of having to go buy one annoys me. Why not raise the price of the product a couple bucks and add one? You can't make yogurt without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian STop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - it's waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It never created an ounce of yogurt in two years This device is absolutely useless. No matter how long do you keep your yogurt in there it's always at the ambient temperature. If you touch the bottom of this "yogurt maker" you can barely feel any heat. Either this device is defective or just plain wrongly designed. As a result, I had to improvise: I bought a temperature sensor, electronic controller, cooler box, and a couple of regular bulbs. This simple device of mine was cheaper, more reliable, and produced tons of high-quality yogurt. This "yogurt maker" is a joke. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana L.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this! I have just started getting into making ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this! I have just started getting into making my own yogurt and holy hell is homemade yogurt better than store-bought. It is sweeter and I like it to have a pretty thick consistency. I serve it with vanilla paste mixed in. This machine is pretty simple. Pour everything in (after heating and then cooling milk) and forget about it for 8 hours, then pour the soupy yogurt into the strainer and forget about it again for 1-2 hours. Done. My only gripe is that the machine doesn't beep or otherwise really alert you after 8 hours. The simple fix is to set an alarm on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but one major flaw: no "ON" light
customer_reviews.text: Yogurt makers are dead simple devices. Maintain 110 F for some time, controlled by a timer. Dash's product is easy to use and clean, very well built, but very frustrating that the only way to tell it is on is if the colon on the very small LED is blinking. I sorta messed up a batch because I thought it was on but it wasn't because I didn't notice that colon, probably 1/4th by 1/16th of an inch, wasn't blinking. Please put a red LED ON light on this device then it'll be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Black

customer_reviews.title: Nice But The Temperature  is too high.
customer_reviews.text: The strainer and containers make straining easy. This is my second Dash Yougurt maker. Both Units Heat too much. The temperature countrol is set way too high. A proper Yogurt maker should maimtain 110 to 115 degrees Fahreheit. I notice my old maker was heating up to 125 degrees Fahrenheit, which was way too much. So I ordered a new one thinking it was defective. Sadly, the new one has the same drfect.
customer_reviews.author: Skycaptain

customer_reviews.title: Great results from this product - customer support gets a zero
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought two of these. They really work well. I made yogurt with whole milk and then let it drain overnight and the consistency was like ricotta cheese - very nice. The only problem I had was that on the first use we cleaned and sterilized the baskets and lids. One lid warped and was then unusable. I sent an email to customer support asking if a replacement lid was available but never heard a word. So a 5 star for the end result product and ease of use, zero stars for customer support gives us an average of 3.
customer_reviews.author: Dean H. Wooldridge Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: This yogurt maker does exactly what is says it will do, with almost no prep required. It's very compact. I don't understand the comments about the hour long prep time. The milk doesn't have to be heated and cooled, especially with the super pasteurized milk. The heating and cooling is actually the pasteurization process. The starter yogurt doesn't even have to be stirred into the milk. Just pour in milk, put in the starter, set the timer, and wait. This takes about a minute. Use the included strainer and second container afterward to strain to the desired consistency--after making sure to save some to use as the starter for the next batch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastically!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit. I had some confusion about which container to make the yogurt in as their instructions say one thing, but the images show the opposite. So I called them. Great customer service! And for the record you make it in the blue container and strain it (if you choose) in the white container. I have made about 8 batches so far and for flavor and the right 'sour' taste 10.5 hours is perfect. I've done regular milk, low fat, no lactose and goat's milk and each batch came out great! I would recommend this product to anyone wanting to make their own yogurt because you can really customize it to your liking.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Makes a cup of yogurt into three cups of yogurt in 10 hours!
customer_reviews.text: And one/two of those hours you need to be incredibly vigilant. We were very careful with the instructions, and out of the four times we tried using it, it only worked well once. We bought it to try to save plastic, but this thing is a waste of plastic, milk and yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Trudyann Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!! Great little appliance.
customer_reviews.text: Love the yogurt I make with this.....but it is way too small for me personally. Because I strain my yogurt to the dryer side, the yield is low for five cups of whole milk. Wish I could put a full half gallon into the machine. Perhaps Dash wants me to buy a 2nd one? Regardless....I love making my own yogurt!! It is so rich and tasty and most of all soooooo easy. Two ingredients and a very simple process make it really worthwhile to make my own yogurt anytime. The few components that come with the unit are very sturdy too. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Great Taste, Great Texture.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife to replace her old yogurt maker. She uses it once a week, makes enough for the entire week and loves it. Says it's a major improvement over the stuff you buy in the store and she's happy she knows just went into each batch! The one improvement she would recommend is don't drain the yogurt before putting it in the fridge. If you do, you wind up with only about 3/4 of the batch, with the other 1/4 wasted as whey. She found that the yogurt absorbs the whey back into the mixture and she's getting more from each batch she makes.
customer_reviews.author: Hacker15

customer_reviews.title: I Recommend this Machine
customer_reviews.text: I like this greek yogurt maker. The yogurt I made in it was delicious. It’s easy to clean. I used a container of store yogurt for my starter but I’d like to try making it using freeze dried cultures next time. I’d recommend this machine if you eat a lot of yogurt. Most value packs of name brand yogurts cost way more than the cost of a gallon of milk. So you do save money with this machine. The pink machine is pretty.
customer_reviews.author: A. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Makes great preservative-free homemade yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: Homemade yogurt is the best! I've had this yogurt maker for almost a week and I just finished making my third batch of delicious organic, preservative free greek yogurt. With this product, you can be the chef! Try different types of milk (whole, 2%, soy, etc...) and different starters. You can even use your last batch as a starter for your next batch. I can never eat store bought yogurt again. This machine is so simple to use and yogurt is so simple to make. I have already recommended this product to friends. Never had a problem with plastic melting.
customer_reviews.author: Hillsong Melody

customer_reviews.title: Double boiler + thermometer needed
customer_reviews.text: The only one thing I disliked on this yogurt maker was the fact that we need to heat up the milk to a certain temperature and let it cool off to a very specific temperature too. Besides the yogurt maker, a double boiler and a thermometer had to be purchased in order for that to work. That was disappointing, specially because no where is that on the description pointed out. That’s a bummer. Besides that, the results were VERY good, the perfect greek yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - great results!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and it is not limited to Greek yogurt if you prefer regular yogurt. I only wish I could make larger batches because homemade yogurt doesn't last long in this household! If you are wondering what to do with the whey left over from Greek yogurt, just mix it about 1 part whey to 4 parts regular milk, put in in the Yogurt Maker for 8-12 hours (or overnight at room temperature) and you wind up with a nice, smooth yogurty drink. I use fresh, raw milk straight from my Jersey cow, so your results may vary depending on your milk source.
customer_reviews.author: Toot Suite

customer_reviews.title: works ok, put I have not been able to ...
customer_reviews.text: works ok, put I have not been able to figure out how they claim it makes 2 quarts at a time when the containers you use are 1.5 quarts. I wanted a large capacity maker and that is rather deceiving. The instructions say to place the container into the yogurt maker so I presumed that you do not pour it directly into the maker itself.
customer_reviews.author: luthier 53

customer_reviews.title: Yogurt came out Lumpy. Too small.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. But there are a couple of issues for me. I've tried it I kept a couple of times and both times my yogurt came out lumpy. I know that this has to do with heating, but I'm not new to making yogurt and this is the first time I've had it have these lumps. The other issue for me is that with all the work that it's involved in making yogurt, it just doesn't make enough. On the plus side, the strainer works great. In fact, if I could buy that all by itself I would be a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returning it
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I will be returning the machine. No matter how many times I watch the youtube videos and follow the directions, the middle of my yogurt is still quite runny and it takes 8 hours of straining to get anywhere close to Greek yogurt. The only thing I have found is that the machine gets too hot to make proper yogurt. I also wish the yeild was a bit higher. It seems like the strainer isn't quite big enough for all five cups of yogurt. I always have a little left in the blue container that won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: L. Little

customer_reviews.title: Easy Healthy Greek Yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Dash Greek Yogurt Maker! It is quite easy to use and since I am completely in control of the ingredients, I am using an organic starter and organic non-GMO milk with no growth hormone. Easy process. Delicious result. Healthy!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! Everything is automatic. Once you get your milk to the right temp, pour it in this yogurt maker and hit start. Eight hours later it's yogurt!! I like that it's one container (approx 5 cups) and not little individual containers. This is an easily affordable product that's well worth the money. I'd give it more stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R

customer_reviews.title: Defective and DANGEROUS yogurt maker, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars!! Piece of garbage!! Straight into the bin!! Chucked this out the house and forgot to take photos, was furious! Please check photos from other posts, they are accurate! Set it to do its work overnight, only to find the inside melted the next morning and the yogurt smelling of burnt plastic. Could have poisoned me or burnt down my home, this is a liability. Checked the rating -- 4.3 / 5.0 stars at time of purchase, what a lie! -- and figured it'd be a safe product to buy (didn't read the reviews like a d*mb*ass). Can't believe that with this many negative reviews Amazon still allow this product to be sold through their platform!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurent Schouten

customer_reviews.title: Favorite purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the best small appliance I've bought in a long time. The directions for yogurt are very easy and I haven't had any problems with how it turns out- just wonderful, especially compared to commercial yogurt. I use the maker two or three times a week. If you love yogurt and don't mind waiting for the great results, get one of these yogurt makers. You won't be disappointed. (It helps to also invest in a good digital candy thermometer for use when heating the milk when you start.).
customer_reviews.author: ladyvaleria9

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: Simple, well designed and great informative instructions. My wife & I have done a few batches with 3 different starter cultures and each has been the best yogurt we have ever tasted. Of course it helps when one uses the best quality organic milk like we did. It was interesting to learn what distinguishes "Greek" yogurt from standard, and about heating the milk to 185of to alter the proteins, which causes it to hold more whey, which also makes it thicker. Very pleased with this product so far. We've been using it for about a month. Hope it doesn't break any time soon. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas K.

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Works good, filled container to top instead of following (directions say 5 cups). And strained in portions instead. Makes more.
customer_reviews.author: erik

customer_reviews.title: Best yogurt ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I have ever bought. I make my own yogurt at least every other day and it is the best yogurt ever. Sometimes I only flavor it with a little sugar and vanilla. It is healthy and very very good. People have offered me money to make yogurt for them but since it does take a considerable amount of time (the machine does all the work) I have refused. I am a private chef and caterer and as such make everything home made. This year I also started making my yogurt into frozen yogurt treats. Soooo good. I have not had ice cream in almost a year. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid W

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't even turn on!
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, but don't trust it to work. Today was my first time using it. My kitchen smells really nice actually with the heated milk. Alas, it wouldn't even turn on! Advertised well; but their quality control lacks greatly if they let a completely useless one through. Don't know about their customer service; haven't called them yet. Pretty bad first impression.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Riches

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you want to try making yogurt at home that tastes great.
customer_reviews.text: Great value if you want to try making yogurt at home that tastes great. The strainer works very well. It looks kind of cheep, it isn't a good counter decoration (unless the color matches your kitchen). You'll need to buy a good digital thermometer to go with it to make good yogurt. Mine unit failed after 2 weeks, and I took it apart and fixed the wiring connections (that was quicker than returning it). It was just assembled too quickly and it was easily fixed. I have a friend that has had one for >1 and it has worked flawlessly and he uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: Why You Should Buy This Machine if You Want Greek Yogurt
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying a yogurt maker specifically to make Greek yogurt, buy this one, because a strainer for making Greek yogurt is included. I paid $24.99 for this machine. The strainer alone would sell for about $18. If you are going to buy a strainer, why not buy this machine instead. It makes great yogurt. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: So much better than store bought!
customer_reviews.text: I love making my own tangy fresh yogurt, and this makes it so easy! Even includes a strainer to make Greek yogurt or, if you leave it draining long enough, Greek cream cheese. Love that it came with extras: to-go containers with a place for my homemade granola and push pop makers for frozen yogurt treats.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good but Small
customer_reviews.text: This Dash machine makes good Greek Yogurt; however, it is small. One batch of yogurt takes a long time to strain because it has to be done in two batches, which is due to the small size of the container and strainer basket. Other than that, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Girl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect Greek yogurt IF you follow directions. But the very best perk with the Dash is the Yogurt Hotline; I've used it twice with a good response from the staff both times.
customer_reviews.author: KYL

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this yogurt maker. I wasted I didn't need a maker, but as a newbie to this I wanted some control measures. This maker is easy to use and produces good results. You just have to know how you like your yogurt and experiment until you get the consistency you want. I used the handy chart and instruction book to gauge my first batch and it helped.
customer_reviews.author: S. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Fun & Yummy
customer_reviews.text: Nice little gizmo with a digital timer that does a good job of 'hatching' the yogurt. Made several batches already; two of them really didn't need to be strained: they turned out nice and thick yet silky after a nine hour 'sit.' Accompanying guide is useful and accurate, even a toll-free help line, but that shouldn't be necessary; yogurt is so easy to whip up in the easy to clean and store Dash.
customer_reviews.author: Saultxy

customer_reviews.title: Yogurt is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, delicious and easy to clean. The 5 cups of milk + 1/2 cup yogurt makes too much yogurt to strain in the strainer provided. I happen to have two strainers (the other is a Donvier), so I can strain the entire mix at one go. The recipes are delicious and I like that I can control the time/sourness of the yogurt to meet whatever recipe I am making. I highly recommend this. I also made pancakes and smoothies with the whey - it doesn't really taste like anything.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Happy device for young kids to use
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter (age 10) is being initiated into cooking arena and this easy working yogurt machine allowed her to fix breakfast for us today. She loves it—and the cost for it was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, make your own yogurt at home
customer_reviews.text: Make your own yogurt! Easy size to maintain, clean and use. Does not take up much space. We made non-dairy yogurt in it mostly. To this day still working well. We use it once a week. Read instructions and online recipes for best results. Lots of recipes online. ReviewsATexchangeentertainmentCom
customer_reviews.author: ReviewsATexchangeentertainmentCom

customer_reviews.title: Great yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: Great yogurt maker. Canisters to pour yogurt mixture into are included.. Could not be easier and the yogurt is delicious....but the strainer is too small. I bought the Euro Cusine GY50 Greek Yogurt Maker (DO NOT KNOW WHY ITS CALLED A YOGURT MAKER WHEN IT'S A LARGE STRAINER). I strain the yogurt in that for a full day and it gets really thick! Both products are very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.R

customer_reviews.title: Once You Find A Good Recipe, This Works Perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This took a couple of trial and errors. It didn't work too well with soy or regular milk alone. But then when I used whole milk with a 1/2 c of milk powder, PERFECTION. It came out better than store bought yogurt and it gave me a 3 c yield and a thick consistency. I've been making it like this ever since but right now I'm trying to perfect a non dairy recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I use this at least once a week and it couldn't be easier. A large double boiler and a good thermometer is all you need. Anyone who cooks a lot should have those items anyway. I cook a lot and am now using yogurt in so many recipes instead of sour cream or cream cheese (you can NOT tell the difference). I use yogurt in cookies and muffins for moisture too.....so good. Try it....you'll like it!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Hate ... hate...  Hate the containers, and lid.
customer_reviews.text: Hate . . . Hate. . . I mean HATE the containers, which warp like crazy. Especially the lid which is useless and doesn't stay on. The unit itself works well. The price is also very good. I like the product and what it does, but hat the containers and lid.
customer_reviews.author: Zaki Mirza

customer_reviews.title: Well priced, very functional
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use & makes cooking yogurt very easy. I use it often & no longer buy yogurt in store. I add milk concentrate powder to thicken & increase protein content of the yogurt & don’t always strain off the whey. Got the same machine for my kids’ households too.
customer_reviews.author: Ezmerelda

customer_reviews.title: I'll never buy premade yogurt again! Too Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Easy as heating the milk to 185F in a double boiler, and letting it cool to 110F ..mix in a 1/2 cup of plain (not vanilla) yoghurt ..beats buying $$$ culture every time...i use a 1/2 cup of my homemade 2 more times as a starter..nothing beats the taste of your own, especially if you use grassfed organic milk! Add some fresh/frozen fruit and YUM!
customer_reviews.author: NikiIsAwesome

customer_reviews.title: If you want to make your own yogurt, get this!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I like being able to make my own yogurt and control what's in it. It makes close to a quart of yogurt at a time. It comes with a really fine mesh strainer to make Greek yogurt with. I strain all the whey out, have Greek yogurt and then use the whey to make bread and smoothies. No waste!
customer_reviews.author: Mioshee Greer

customer_reviews.title: Investment that will paid by himself
customer_reviews.text: I started using it as soon as I received it. It is very easy to set and so far all my batches came as wanted. The strainer is very sturdy and all containers are easy to clean. Customer service is outstanding. I left my containers in a motel room during a recent trip, I contacted the company and they sent a replacement immediately without any charge. If you love Greek yogurt this is an investment that will paid by himself.
customer_reviews.author: July AZ

customer_reviews.title: A very good purchase
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this, I really wasn't sure it was a good idea. My wife and I each eat Greek yogurt every day, so we go through a lot of yogurt every week. As it turned out, fresh homemade yogurt really is good, and we get to make flavors that we like that aren't available in the store. After a few batches, I found out exactly what works best for me, and now it is easy to do. We are very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone who likes Greek yogurt. Oh, and it paid for itself in just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I consider this a good purchase and would recommend this yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: The 1st use of the Dash Greek Yogurt maker didn't go well. I kept taking the temperature of the yogurt and my thermometer kept reading too hot. So I decided just to not take the temp at all, and trust that 8 hours would be sufficient. Since then, I've only had one batch not work. Overall, I consider this a good purchase and would recommend this yogurt maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: It's inexpensive and works as well as the 50 dollar ones.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this steadily for a week (2 batches a day most days) and the first day I was concerned because it felt hotter than I'm used to, but it's almost like it needed to get it out of it's system because after that it's been working wonderfully. For 24 dollars with a strainer and buckets it's really not bad. The auto shutoff is really nice. Of course I will update if anything changes, but so far with over 10 perfect batches under it's belt I'm pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.author: J. Holman

customer_reviews.title: Love the little blue machine!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little machine; easy to make yogurt and Greek yogurt. Easy to clean. Nothing better than fresh yogurt without chemicals or flavored fruit. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Makes beautiful yogurt with cow's milk. I'm still perfecting how to make nut milks. Lots of info online about how to do this, but so far it's not perfected. I think the secret is making your own non-dairy milks from scratch, which I will do next and update.
customer_reviews.author: Annabanana

customer_reviews.title: Useless Waste of Money and Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Machine melted from the inside on first use on a 10hr cycle. The toxic plastic smell was horrible and the it was very hot. One litre of home made organic coconut milk gone to waste. It's one thing selling a cheap product that may or may not work or last very long but a completely new level selfish irresponsibility, selling a product that turns out to be a life or health risk! Very badly done...DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Bonnici

customer_reviews.title: Greek Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: I just love this yogurt maker, I been making greek yogurt since the day I got it. The yogurt is nice and thick, taste wonderful. I think it taste better than store bought.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Desert

customer_reviews.title: I wish it were larger
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been making yogurt at home for several years, heating the milk, cooling the milk, adding starter and then trying to maintain temp while the starter would do it’s magic. Now the Dash keeps the temp right and creates yogurt in about 1/2 the time. The strainer is great for making Greek yogurt, which I prefer. Works well! I just wish it was larger!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Totten

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: works great only problem with it is it needs a larger screen strainer, it makes 2qt but the screen is to small to hold it all to drain for greek yogurt. needs a 2qt strainer
customer_reviews.author: Jim P.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I followed the yogurt directions exactly and it made terrific yogurt, just as advertised. The directions are easy to follow, it's easy to wash it, and easy to use it. What's not to like?? I will probably buy another for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: AP1980

customer_reviews.title: Love Dash Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product , I love the yogurt it makes. Tips: - To get thicker yogurt , add half glass of Milk powder to the milk before heating it. - To get sour yogurt, add one or two hours to the Dash Maker recommended time. The things I hope the next Dash Maker will have: 1- Milk preparation process (heating and cooling milk) , with current Dash Maker you have to heat/cool milk before putting it in the Dash Maker 2- Support for 220 volt ,current Dash Maker only works on 110 volt you need to buy a "220v to 110v converter" to use it in countries with 220v.
customer_reviews.author: Tariq

customer_reviews.title: Perfect greek yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: I bought because the pretty color, but I am in love with my natural greek yogurt!
customer_reviews.author: Gladys Stone

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in 2 batches
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best decisions I've made when it comes to eating foods free of additives. 4$ in milk makes roughly 35$ of yogurt. Real yogurt, not liquified candy bars they sell at the store. Pays for itself in 2 batches. Sturdy storage container. Cleans up fairly easy, The only thing i can find wrong with it is the lid has a grove, the reverse side of the handle, that my big fingers cant fit into to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Samples

customer_reviews.title: This dinky little appliance is wonderful. I have gotten the art of making yogurt ...
customer_reviews.text: This dinky little appliance is wonderful. I have gotten the art of making yogurt down to 100 seconds, precisely! I add 4 cups of skim milk, half a cup of skim milk, half a cup of yogurt straight from the fridge into the container like another reviewer suggested, whisk it up, pop it on overnight for 10 hours, and taa-daaaaah! It's ready in the morning and perfect. No need to heat up the milk and other faff. The texture is silky and I love being able to experiment with different types of milk and yogurt starters. You won't regret buying this - it's cheap as chips, looks cute on my kitchen counter and really, actually, properly works!
customer_reviews.author: A Modern Olympia

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised how easy this worked
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how easy this worked. The first time I tried it I prepared it before going to bed and was surprised that it was done when I woke up. Now the only time I buy store bought is to replenish my starter. I found some natural strawberry jam to sweeten.
customer_reviews.author: A. G. Gant

customer_reviews.title: Two-in-one LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I have made homemade yogurt for decades and strained it with a yogurt strainer (that I have had for 40 years)...what is now being marketed as "Greek Yogurt". What this product is, is both in one. A yogurt maker and a strainer. Nice to have it all in one!
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Free Yogurt
customer_reviews.text: Follow the directions and don't think this is going to be a quick system. It takes about 10 hours start to finish. I have found that starting the process at night and then waking up to finish is much easier. However, once the yogurt is made it's awesome. I love not have all the extra chemicals in my food and can now make any flavor I want.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, makes yogurt in 8 hours. I’ve never made yogurt before, now i make my own healthy yogurt with lots of probiotics.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Great product and seller!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and seller! I liked the first one so much that I bought another for added production. I will also be sending some as gifts to family during the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2000

customer_reviews.title: works great i use weekly
customer_reviews.text: Great yogurt maker. I have used 2% and whole both are delicious and make good thick yogurt. I use 1/2 cup store bought yogurt for starter each time that, seems to work better than using the yogurt I make. The strainer does not get clogged like when you use cheese cloth and cleans easily in the dishwasher. This has made the process much simpler.
customer_reviews.author: MightyGai

customer_reviews.title: Meets my need perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This little machine meets my needs exactly. I had read many reviews for other machines and also many recipes. Therefore, I knew there was an incubation period for the yogurt in which you needed to keep your yogurt warm for the bacteria to multiply. I didn't want to worry about this. The yogurt maker works perfectly for my purposes. I have learned how to make different types of yogurt and different consistencies based on how long you strain it, if at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toler

customer_reviews.title: Does the job as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. It was very easy to use..book of recipes and directions were excellent. Nice to have 2 inserts for your yogurt mix. The strainer works beautifully. I made my second batch this evening. I have no issues with this product...so far, is working as presented. I did a good deal of research prior to purchasing and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this! If you are competent at following instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! If you are competent at following instructions this can make fantastic yogurt. I like it more strained for a richer yogurt. my wife likes it less strained for a smoother yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom, and she LOVES it. Every time I talk with her on the weekends shes making yogurt. She's told all her friends about it. The taste of yogurt it produces is amazing. I think she does wish it was bigger though, as I know she makes multiple batches one after another.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Nice little machine, but display is dying.
customer_reviews.text: Nice yogurt maker, but the display is dying, which is the only way to set the time. Also, no audible when the time is complete. That being said, it seems to hold a consistent temperature and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: P. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: it was easy and did a great job
customer_reviews.text: Made my first batch of yogurt yesterday (whole raw goat milk) and I have to say, it was easy and did a great job. The strainer worked well to give and nice thick yogurt after cooling in the fridge. Would recommend- thumbs up. Follow directins, and I suggest a good digital thermometer for the vest results when preparing the milk for the machine.
customer_reviews.author: J. HaleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cute and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Perfect size for myself. Cute color. Makes a tasty yogurt simply. Love the strainer for getting Greek yogurt or yogurt cheese. Delish
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Heiden

customer_reviews.title: The instructions and recipes that came with the machine were so easy. I made my first batch and everyone agreed ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! Never made yogurt before but we eat a lot of it. I thought I’d give it a try. The instructions and recipes that came with the machine were so easy. I made my first batch and everyone agreed it was the best they ever tasted.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for a good price. Easy to use and works well as advertised. The built in strainer makes it easy to make greek yogurt without having to use cheesecloth or other options. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MOON SOO SHIN

customer_reviews.title: great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Love my yogurt and this makes great yogurt! The delivery service was very quick and the product excellent! The easy to read and follow instructions were great!
customer_reviews.author: Inspired Grandma!

customer_reviews.title: Love love love the yogurt it tastes amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love love love the yogurt it tastes amazing!!! One comment tho the strainer does not hold all the yogurt which is kind of annoying you have to wait for it to strain to fit it all otherwise you have about. 3/4 cup untrained regular and the rest to strain to make Greek style.
customer_reviews.author: KATE G

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We make all our own Greek Yogurt now - I prefer to buy cultures online than to buy store-bought yogurt - I make a batch every week in the summer
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Whisler

customer_reviews.title: Much better than store-bought
customer_reviews.text: It's a little extra work, but I really enjoy the final product. I make about 4 6-8oz cups, throw a few blueberries and a little granola on top. I pretty much have a system down to produce a steady and consistent product. I may try cottage cheese using meyer lemons just for something a little different.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffro the Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact "pot" and works very well. It is easy to store. The strainer is nice and sits well in the pot where the yogurt can drain easily without spilling. I'm happy with the way the yogurt comes out and I can see it is already a great addition to my kitchen. We eat a lot of yogurt so this was well worth the price. The only thing I might change if I could would be to have it hold more so I wouldn't have to make it so often.
customer_reviews.author: Ardie

customer_reviews.title: Great Yogart Maker
customer_reviews.text: Great little yogurt maker! I bought 2! I used to use coffee filters to drain the excess liquid. This is all in one!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Henry

customer_reviews.title: disappointed, will return
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews and purchased this. After three trials, I see that the yogurt is made ok, but the temp is too hot and curds up the milk quite a bit. I wish it had temperature control. I would rather it take longer to make better yogurt. Also the timer is just very basic, and can't really control the heat this was either.
customer_reviews.author: UDAY SHIVASWAMY

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Works well, has a small profile, and is very easy to use. I make non-dairy yogurt weekly at a fraction of the cost of store-bought and none of the added sugar. Love love love.
customer_reviews.author: OnAnAdventureCallBackLater

customer_reviews.title: Great yogurt maker, bad yogurt storage.
customer_reviews.text: I love this yogurt maker, the automatic timer makes it very easy to use reliably. The size is perfect for holding a wide mouth quart sized mason jar which cuts down on plastic exposure on my food and makes storage easier than the provided containers. The strainer works great if you moisten it before pouring in the yogurt. My only criticism is that the lid provided does a terrible job covering yogurt that is straining and I use a plastic stretch cover instead.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Make your own Greek Yogurt
customer_reviews.text: Found this to be easy to use just as a prior review stated. Have used twice and used cream, milk and half-and-half and the yogurt tasted a lot like sour cream. Going to try it again using nut milk - hoping it tuns out the same or better!. The longer you strain it the thicker it gets!
customer_reviews.author: HeelShields

customer_reviews.title: Will use it forever!
customer_reviews.text: Makes greek yogurt like a charm! The timer is a little bit hard to see though. I like the accessories it came with. It took me a couple gallons of milk to get the process right but that was my fault. The color blue is bright and looks more like a toy on my counter but I think it looks fun and once I got the process right, it is fun and mire delicious than the store yogurts.
customer_reviews.author: lorie

customer_reviews.title: Great Yogurt Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about 4 times now and every time the yogurt came out perfect. I ended using the greek strainer for about 6-7 hours in the fridge and my family loved it. We add a little honey and granola and tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Patterson3024

customer_reviews.title: great yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, follow the directions, cleans up easily, takes several hours so don't expect the yogurt to be ready the same day, best to make it overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Tedeschi

customer_reviews.title: Dash Yogurt Maker
customer_reviews.text: Have already made several batches of yogurt in the Dash & am very pleased with the results. Comes with a quick dial reference 'recipe' card as well as a book. I would love it even more if it made larger batches of yogurt but because of the ease of preparation, etc., a fresh batch can be made every couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: mar

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, and the recipe guide is great. My only complaint is that the strainer for the Greek yogurt doesn't hold the full capacity of the maker. Delicious yogurt though. Both of my kids say it's better than store-bought.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller version and love it, but I wanted to be able to make more yogurt at a time. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: alm711

customer_reviews.title: and perfect. I love this yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: I just made my first batch of yogurt yesterday and ate it this morning. It was thick, creamy, and perfect. I love this yogurt maker. It is elegantly simple. It does what I need it to do without a lot of bells and whistles. The price is reasonable, the instructions very helpfully written, and it works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Tutu

customer_reviews.title: Lot of wrk for little yogurt
customer_reviews.text: 5 cups milk turned into 1.5 cups yogurt. Huge bummer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Di not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I teturned this item twice. It worked for three batches and failed to work on two subsequent batches. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Califano

product_meta.title: Dash Greek Yogurt Maker Machine with LCD Display + 2 BPA-Free Storage Containers with Lids, Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueIf you love the creamy, satisfying texture of Greek yogurt, the Dash Greek Yogurt Maker will be your new go-to kitchen tool. Get all of the probiotic benefits of Greek yogurt without the additives or the steep cost of store bought brands. Just use any type of milk and a little bit of store-bought yogurt to get started. A comprehensive Recipe Guide is included along with a Quick Start dial for easy reference. You will also gain access to our rapidly growing database of recipes! Make custom flavors, healthy gourmet treats -- and save money on store-bought Greek yogurt!
feature_bullets: HEALTHIER: Dash Greek Yogurt Maker Machine lets you make healthier, homemade yogurt right from your kitchen. You control the ingredients (Organic? Sweetened? Flavored? Plain?) making it better for you and your family
COMPACT + LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighing 2lbs, this is a must-have for that first apartment, smaller kitchen, or college dorm. Plus, all accessories fit inside the base, taking up even less space, BONUS!

QUICK + EASY: Set it and forget it! Prep time takes just 10 minutes (add milk, yogurt starter and other custom ingredients), leave overnight, and you will enjoy fresh, homemade Greek yogurt in just 8-12 hours (up to 2qts)

PERFECT GIFT: The perfect wedding or new home gift. Its small size takes up little counter space, and its sleek design and trendy color options will match any kitchen décor (add to your registry now!)

INCLUDES: Backed by a 1-year manufacturer warranty, the 20-watt Dash Greek Yogurt Maker, includes 2 BPA-free buckets with lids, strainer basket, recipe book, and recipe database access. All non-electric parts are easily wiped clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,059 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
